chapter.para: Here you will find information about &nation_name; and its major settlments that any individual who lives in or has briefly researched the nation would know. Feel free to use these sections to help build your characters and integrate them into the world.

&nation_name; was founded roughly 450 years ago when crusaders from a temple of Abadar in &meadows_nation; embarked on a mission to colonize the region. They swore a holy oath that the new nation would be an exemplar of civilation and glory for centuries to come. At that moment, they founded the &crusade_org; and dedicated themselves to the cause of sharing this glory with the world. To that end, they established a means of constructing and linking &portals;—magical gates which can be used to travel to and from &nation_name;. Immigrants to the new nation were slow to come at first, but they did arrive. And as they arrived, they founded successful new lives in the bountiful valley of &valley_name;. Word spread, and the population of &nation_name; grew exponentially as people from all over the continent came to investigate this new wonder and found their expectations exceeded. It was not long before the fledling nation became the hub of luxury, trade, and travel that it is today.

section.para: In the heart of the valley of &valley_name;, protected by the forboding &mountain_range; to the north and the unfathomable &rift; to the south, &nation_name; echoes with a clarion call of opportunity. Low, rolling hills stretch across the landscape, and lush green forests intermingle with networks of towns and villages. Occasionally, gleaming cities sit at the center of these networks, marking the terrain with intricate webs of road that connect settlements for miles around. Along the foothills of the &mountain_range;, frontier towns dot lands carved with snow-melt rivers that from the peaks above to empty into &valley_lake;.

The abundance of the valley may provide, but ultimately the people of &nation_name; are its lifeblood. Most citizens live and work in ostensibly simple villages, where they develop arable land and pull forth rich resources from the valley's mines. Their harvests flow inward toward the cities of the nation, where they supply insatiable craftsmen and merchants who give &nation_name; its reputation as an economic and cultural superpower. In return, the inner settlements provide ample public works, education, infrastructure, and other resources that allow the outland residents to specialize and thrive. All the while, brave and resourceful frontiersmen pave the way for others to follow in their footsteps and expand the glory of the nation.

&nation_name; was founded as part of an Abadarian religious crusade, and its roots are still apparent to this day. Although the nation is not strictly aligned with any one deity, its senate is composed of eighteen representatives from the most influential temples—be it influence through number of worshipers, wealth, or other means. Currently the temples of Abadar, Shelyn, Cayden Cailean, Sarenrae, Pharasma, Iomedae, and Erastil hold senate positions. The temple of Abadar has maintained major power in the city, and from the gilded halls of &abadar_temple; in &law_city; it oversees much of the nation's financial and legal well-being. Shelyn and Cayden Cailean both have large followings in &arts_city;, and their temples—&shelyn_temple; and &cc_temple;—draw tourists and worshippers from far and wide.

Iomedae's temple is the &police_hq; in &law_city; and much of the police force are devotees. Sarenrae, Pharasma, and Erastil enjoy large popular support from all around the nation for their public services and good works, but they do not maintain large shrines or temples in any one location. Many other faiths have worshippers in &nation_name;, and although they do not hold prominent political power, Desna, Gozreh, Calistria, and Irori all have noteworthy followings in various places around the country.

Outwardly, the government of &nation_name; is composed of three parts: an Emperor, a Senate, and &HoRs;. The Emperor is an elected official rather than a supreme ruler. There is no term limit for an Emperor, but most choose to rule for twenty to twenty five years before stepping down. The Emperor holds the power to veto laws, act as the commander of the &police;, and also resolves tie votes in the Senate. The Senate comprises eighteen leaders chosen from and by the nation's most eminent temples, with each temple holding a number of positions corresponding with their influence. Senators are solely responsible for ratifying laws, and they also have the power to call for an immediate re-election of the Emperor. &HoRs; are officials elected every four years by the citizens of their districts. Legally, the &HoRs; have only three powers: they elect the Emperor from one of their own, they are the only citizens, besides the Emperor, permitted to directly address a meeting of the Senate, and they may vote to forcibly remove Senators from office for life.

sidebar.para: Currently, the temple of Abadar is allocated eight senate seats. Shelyn holds three, and Sarenrae and Cayden Cailean each hold two. Pharasma, Iomedae, and Erastil are all represented, but each holds only one seat.
